abstract.shortdesc: Post-integration verification steps for your with NSX for vSphere environment.

section.p: Once you have completed your deployment and integrated the NSX-v Neutron plugin, you can use these steps to verify that NSX-v is enabled and working in the environment.

section.title: Validate Neutron from the lifecycle manager
section.p: From the lifecycle manager node, verify that Neutron services are working and the output is as expected by running these commands:
section.note: All of these commands require that you authenticate and you can do so by sourcing the provided service.osrc file: source ~/service.osrc

section.title: Verify metadata proxy functionality
section.p: To test that the metadata proxy virtual machines are working as intended, verify that there are at least two metadata proxy virtual machines from within vSphere (there will be four if edge high availability was set to true).

Once that is verified, create a new compute instance either with the API, CLI, or within the cloud console GUI and log into the instance. From within the instance, using curl, attempt to grab the metadata instance-id from the metadata proxy address.curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/instance-id
